title: Pinterest Stock Falls On Earnings Release
summary:
Pinterest stock fell.
Pinterest stock dropped 9%, near 18.95, during after-hours trading on the stock market today.
Strategic Priorities For 2020"Our strategic priorities for 2020 remain content, ads diversification, use case expansion and shopping," the Pinterest earnings release said.
RBC Capital Markets analyst Mark Mahaney has an outperform rating and price target on Pinterest stock of 27.
Pinterest stock, since hitting a record low of 10.10 in mid-March, has more than doubled.
text:
Pinterest (PINS) reported first-quarter earnings late Tuesday that beat on revenue but slightly missed on earnings. Pinterest stock fell.

X

The company reported an adjusted loss of 10 cents a share on revenue of $272 million. Wall Street expected a loss of 9 cents on revenue of $269.5 million.

Pinterest stock dropped 9%, near 18.95, during after-hours trading on the stock market today.

Wall Street analysts will focus on what Pinterest has to say about advertising spending trends looking ahead, during the earnings call.

Ad spending is what Wall Street focused on when Facebook (FB) reported earnings last week. That was true as well when Google-owner Alphabet (GOOGL) also reported results last week. Ad spending did indeed drop. But as it turned out, shares of Facebook and Alphabet popped the next day as analysts grew more optimistic that the situation was not as dire as thought.

Pinterest gave preliminary first-quarter expectations on April 17 and withdrew its revenue and earning guidance for 2020.

Strategic Priorities For 2020

"Our strategic priorities for 2020 remain content, ads diversification, use case expansion and shopping," the Pinterest earnings release said.



"The spread of Covid-19 has certainly had an impact on our business and the businesses of our advertisers, but we remain optimistic about the future," Pinterest Chief Financial Officer Todd Morgenfeld said in written remarks.

The company did not provide revenue or earnings guidance for 2020, as expected. Pinterest said it expects to continue to grow operating expenses in the second quarter, year over year, but at a slower pace compared to the first quarter.

"The near-term financial impact of this pandemic is rapidly evolving and difficult to measure and quantify," the company said when it gave guidance on April 17. "First-quarter revenue performance was consistent with our expectations through the middle of March, when we began to see a sharp deceleration."

Pinterest Stock: Less Exposure To Ad Crunch?

On the positive side, Pinterest said its exposure to some of the most affected segments like travel, automotive, and restaurants "has not been significant."

As a result, Pinterest stock popped 12% in reaction.

Pinterest provides a website where users post photos, charts and other images covering a wide range of categories and interests, with visual search capabilities.

It reported monthly active users of about 367 million, in line with estimates.

The company held its initial public offering about one year ago, pricing shares at 19. Its record high is 36.83, reached on Aug. 22.

RBC Capital Markets analyst Mark Mahaney has an outperform rating and price target on Pinterest stock of 27.

Facebook, Google Popped After Earnings

"We will be looking for color on whether ad revenue growth trends have stabilized, like Facebook and Alphabet," Mahaney wrote in a note to clients.

A common theme in the Facebook and Alphabet earnings report was that ad revenue came under significant pressure in March before showing signs of stability in April.

Alphabet stock is up about 10% since its earnings report. Facebook stock is up 8%.

Pinterest stock, since hitting a record low of 10.10 in mid-March, has more than doubled.

Please follow Brian Deagon on Twitter at @IBD_BDeagon for more on tech stocks, analysis and financial markets.
